column4: trying to build expocity i get "No package 'gtk+-2.0' found"   it mentions i might need to add it to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH... is that an unbuntu thing? is it in a non-standard location?
dont bother with it, use skippy instead
url?  any specific reason for it being better?
expocity is a patch to metacity, potentially destabilising your wm, etc skippy is just an app, that imho works better anyway
excellent.. i'll give it a go ;-)
if you google theres a deb of it somewhere, its not in ubuntu
ah works... but is rather slow to grab the windows ;-(    (especially first time cycling through the lot)
think i'll stick to alt-tab instead ;-)
wouldn't it be great if alt-tab did a smooth fade-out of current window to smooth fade-in of new one, and cycle through the list like that? ;-)

i guess so, just eye candy though, i enabled xorg composite, drop shadows and transparency the other day, only for like 10 minutes though, it was nice, but kinda pointless, and just uses more resources

well yeah i dont much fancy pointless eyecandy, but the problem i have with alt-tab is that i have soo many apps open that that little window with icons doesn't tell me enough... i'd like a better visual representation of what window is what
i generally have a few virtual desktops, and then i have mail open on one, browser on another, etc
tried that, but for whatever reason i always end up having 99 apps in one desktop and only 1 in all the others ;-)
